resources.string: "Al-Masjid an-Nabawi, known in English as The Prophet's Mosque, is a mosque built by the prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him). It was the second mosque built by the prophet in Madinah, after Masjid Quba'a, and is now one of the largest mosques in the world. It is the second-holiest site in Islam, after the Masjid al-Haram in Mecca. It is always open, regardless of date or time, and was only closed to visitors in modern times, once, during the COVID-19 pandemic. "
